arm_group.description: PD patients carriers of the G2019S mutation in the LRRK2 gene

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a longitudinal study in patients with Parkinson's Disease (PD) carriers of a genetic
      mutation - substitution of gly with ser in position 2019 (G2019S) in the leucine-rich repeat
      kinase 2 (LRRK2) gene. The purpose of this study is to explore the association between
      genetic mutations in the known genes and their influence on disease manifestation over few
      years of follow up

clinical_study.brief_title: A Longitudinal Study in Parkinson's Disease (PD) Patients

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  parkinson'd disease patients that already participated in a pasr cross sectional
             study

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  subjects with cognitive decline by the parameters defined in  Diagnostic and
             Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (DSM)- IV

          -  subjects with psychiatric disorder

          -  subjects unable to sign a consent form

study_pop.textblock: PD patients carriers of the G2019S mutation in the LRRK2 gene

clinical_study.official_title: A Longitudinal 5 Years Follow up Study in Parkinson's Disease (PD) Patients Carriers of the LRRK2 Gene G2019S Mutation

primary_outcome.measure: change from baseline in updrs motor and total scores
primary_outcome.time_frame: the participants will be followed for 5 years. the measurements will be taken evry 18 month.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.
